page.topic: Object name in parent List for this List's data
page.description: The data for this List will be read from the data in the current row of the parent List. You need to specify the name of the object in the parent List's data object that contains the data for this row. IMPORTANT: If this List is based on a SQL query and has a 'Detail View' that is updateable, the object name MUST start with _LIST_ (e.g. _LIST_Orders)

section.description: This property shows up in the List Builder's Static and Custom data source types. While relying on SQL data is perhaps more practical for creating cascading lists, it is still possible to make cascading lists from static data. Here is how:

step.description: Open the UX Builder and go to the UX Controls page. Scroll through the Data Controls list until you come to the [List] Control. Click [List] to add a list control to your component. Give this control the name 'parent'.

Highlight the 'parent' list control and scroll down the control's properties list on the right until you come to the List Properties. Click the [...] button next to the List properties property. The List Builder will open.
Open the Data Source tab. Select Static as the 'Data Source Type:'.
Still on the Data Source tab, click the [...] button next to the Static data property
In the Static Choices box add the following JSON data and then click OK.
Go to the List Layout tab. Use the blue > arrow to move the 'Firstname' and 'Lastname' fields from the 'available fields' list into the 'columns in list'. Click OK to close the list builder.
On the UX Controls page, go back to the Data Controls menu and add a second [List] control to the component. Give this control the name 'child'.
Highlight the 'child' list control and open it's List Builder; by clicking [...] button next to the List properties property on the right or by double clicking on the control itself.
On the Data Source tab select 'Static' in the Data Source Type menu.
Click the [...] button next to the Static data property.
In the Static Choices dialog add the following and click OK
In the Parent List section check the Has parent list checkbox.
Set the 'Parent list id' property to 'parent', the name of the first list control
Now set the 'Object name in parent List for this List's data' to read 'Children'.
step.note: Here 'Children' references the 'Children' array object that is stored in the JSON data in the 'parent' control. The Name|Age that we already defined as static data for the 'child' list control will draw their value from the Name and Age properties inside the Children array object,.

step.description: Go to the List Layout tab and use the blue > arrow to move the 'Name' and 'Age' fields from the Available Fields list to the Columns in List.
Click OK to close the List Builder. Run the Component in Live Preview.
Try clicking on any given row in the 'Parent' list. You should see the 'Child' list change to match.
